Name: Milanese Breakfast Martini
Instructions: STIR marmalade with gin, bitter liqueur and lemon juice in base of shaker to dissolve the marmalade. SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. TOP with sparkling wine.
Review: A fruity but dry aperitif drink served 'up' but with a splash of prosecco sparkle.
History: Adapted from a drink originally named Breakfast in Milan by Dawid Steenkamp at Jamie Oliver's Barbecoa in London, England, and inspired by the Negroni and Salvatore's Breakfast Martini .
